result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.

ALL PARTIES TO THE ACTION SHALL APPEAR IN PERSON FOR THIS HEARING.  THIS HEARING IS NOT BEING HELD VIA ZOOM.

3:03 PM Defendant Heather A.G. Green appeared by video.  Attorney Hynek in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Carly R Fish appeared by video for Heather A.G. Green. Close to resolution. Set for plea. Atty Fish will call JA for date and time.
6/27/22 STC rescheduled per request of Attorney Carly Fish; need additional time to receive open records request info; ok'd with DA's office. CLO

Status conference on August 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Court questioned defendant on her understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing time limits.  She stated she understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived her right to have a preliminary hearing within time limits.
